title: Choking
desc: Airway blockage due to food or object.
steps: If yes and can't speak — do 5 back blows.

title: Severe Bleeding
steps: Apply direct pressure to the wound.
Keep applying pressure — do not remove cloth.

title: Burns
desc: Treatment for minor and major burns.
steps: Cool the burn under running water for 10-20 minutes.
Cover with sterile gauze, not cotton.
Call for emergency help if severe.

title: Stroke
desc: Recognize and respond to stroke symptoms.
steps: Use FAST: Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech difficulty, Time to call help.

title: Seizures
desc: What to do during a seizure.
steps: Stay calm. Do not restrain them.
Turn them gently on one side.
Call for help if lasts more than 5 minutes.

title: Heart Attack
desc: Sudden chest pain, shortness of breath, possible cardiac arrest.
steps: Keep the person calm and seated upright.
Start CPR if the person loses consciousness and stops breathing.

title: Electric Shock
desc: Person injured due to contact with electric current.
steps: Do not touch them directly — turn off power first.
Treat burns with cool cloth but avoid ice or ointments.

title: Poisoning
desc: Accidental or intentional ingestion of toxic substance.
steps: Do not induce vomiting unless advised by medical personnel.
Call poison control or emergency services immediately.
Try to identify the poison (container, label, etc.).
Keep the person calm and monitor breathing.
Turn them on their side if vomiting occurs.
